Package cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.domain.entities

Class DateAndTime

java.lang.Object
cz.cuni.mff.mozharon.financialaccounting.domain.entities.DateAndTime
public class DateAndTime extends Object
Represents date and time details within the financial accounting application. This class encapsulates date and time information with methods for validation.

    • DateAndTime

      public DateAndTime(String dateAndTime)
      Constructs a DateAndTime object from a formatted string.
      Parameters:
      dateAndTime - The date and time string in "dd mm yyyy hh mm ss" format.

    • DateAndTime

      public DateAndTime(int day, int month, int year, int seconds, int minutes, int hours)
      Constructs a DateAndTime object from individual date and time components.
      Parameters:
      day - The day of the month (1-31).
      month - The month of the year (1-12).
      year - The year.
      seconds - The second of the minute (0-59).
      minutes - The minute of the hour (0-59).
      hours - The hour of the day (0-23).

    • setDate

      public void setDate(int inputDay, int inputMonth, int inputYear, int inputSeconds, int inputMinutes, int inputHours)

      Sets the date and time using individual parameters, handling potential exceptions.

      Parameters:
      inputDay - The day of the month.
      inputMonth - The month (1-12).
      inputYear - The year.
      inputSeconds - The second of the minute (0-59).

      Logs a warning if an exception occurs during the process, indicating potential value issues.

      inputMinutes - The minute of the hour (0-59).
      inputHours - The hour of the day (0-23).

    • setDate

      public void setDate(String inputDate)

      Sets the date and time based on a string representation. Expects a string with six space-separated parameters: day, month, year, second, minute, hour. If the string is empty, uses current date and time as default values.

      Parameters:
      inputDate - A string representation of the date. Example: "25 12 2015 12 32 00""
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - If the input has an incorrect number of parameters.
